abstract: Slowing economic growth sent prices for aluminum lower, hurting Alcoa's third-quarter profit; earnings were $172 million, or 15 cents a share, compared with $61 million, or 6 cents a share a year earlier; revenue rose 21 percent, to $6.4 billion, but was 3 percent lower than the second quarter.
snippet: Alcoa’s chief executive, Klaus Kleinfeld, warned of weak economic conditions through the year, particularly in Europe, “as confidence in the global recovery faded.”
lead_paragraph: Alcoa’s chief executive, Klaus Kleinfeld, warned of weak economic conditions through the year, particularly in Europe, “as confidence in the global recovery faded.”

headline.main: Metal Prices Hurt Alcoa’s Third-Quarter Profit
headline.print_headline: Metal Prices Hurt Alcoa’s Third-Quarter Profit
